Dating: 3RD INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not before); PTOLEMAIC PERIOD (not after)
Name: Faience shabti
Description: A blue-green glazed faience shabti, with back pillar and plinth. The wig is plain, the beard is plaited. The figure holds a hoe and pick, with a basket on the back. The inscription is in the 'T-form' but is worn. The shabti is on a modern wooden mount.
